meanings.definition: A person who acts on behalf of another.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent helped us find our dream home.
meanings.sent2: Insurance agents work to protect their clients from financial loss.
meanings.sent3: The agents of the charity organization tirelessly support those in need.
meanings.sent4: Kindness acts as an agent of positive change in the world.
meanings.sent5: The agent of change brought about a new era of progress and innovation.

meanings.definition: A substance that causes a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The cleaning agent removed the tough stains from the carpet.
meanings.sent2: Chemical agents are used in laboratories for various experiments.
meanings.sent3: The baking soda acted as an agent to make the cake rise beautifully.
meanings.sent4: Time can be an agent of rust on metal surfaces.
meanings.sent5: The catalyst acted as an agent to speed up the reaction.

meanings.sent1: The undercover agent gathered crucial information for the mission.
meanings.sent2: Secret agents operate in the shadows to gather intelligence.
meanings.sent3: The agent disguised as a waiter overheard the secret conversation.
meanings.sent4: Trust can be a double-edged agent in the world of espionage.
meanings.sent5: The agent's cover was blown during the risky operation.
